member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.PlugIns.CustomPlugInContainerBase`1
member.summary: A base class for custom plugin containers, where defines the common interface type of the plugin container. The custom plugin container basically collects all plugins of this type, and provides the method to retrieve a specific plugin interface. For a specific plugin interface, there can only be one 'effective' implementation. This base class defines abstract methods which help to select these 'effective' implementations.
member.typeparam: The type of the plug in.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.PlugIns.CustomPlugInContainerBase`1.#ctor(MUnique.OpenMU.PlugIns.PlugInManager)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The plugin manager which manages this instance.

member.returns: true if the new plug in should replace the currently effective plug in; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Determines the new effective plug in, after the previous one has been deactivated.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.PlugIns.PlugInContainerBase`1.AddPlugIn(`0,System.Boolean)
member.exception: The current thread has not entered the lock in write mode.

The property is and the current thread has already entered the lock in any mode. -or- The current thread has entered read mode, so trying to enter the lock in write mode would create the possibility of a deadlock. -or- The recursion number would exceed the capacity of the counter. The limit is so large that applications should never encounter it.
